text: "The SEACOM undersea cable, which provides a data link between South Africa, Europe and India, experienced downtime beginning on Saturday 8 October 2011, caused by a problem on a cable between Abu Talat (Egypt) and Marseilles (France). . Meanwhile, local Internet Service Providers (ISPs) who use bandwidth on the SEACOM cable have been scrambling to implement contingency plans to keep their customers connected". According to an MWEB update - "Some more bandwidth was brought online last night [10 October 2011] bringing us up to 83% of our required capacity. We allowed P2P traffic to run from midnight to 7am, after which it had to give way for critical traffic again. " As MWEB also uses PeerApp's caching solution, it may help serve some P2P traffic without accessing the undersea cable.
title: South Africa : P2P Control Helps Overcome Undersea Cable Outage.
